message.subject: Late Delivery
message.content:
M1.1. Peter
[Conventional: salutation]
M1.2. Welcome to Enron!
[Conventional: welcome]
M1.3. I usually get to the London office a couple of times a
year and will look forward to meeting you there.
[Inform: Mark looks forward to meeting Peter in London]
M1.4. If not, hopefully we'll see
you at the Law Conference in the Spring.
[Inform: if this doesn't happen, Mark will see Peter at the spring Law Conference]
M1.5. Most of your e-mail is well outside my area of expertise.
[Inform: most of Peter's email is outside Mark's area of expertise]
Sflink1.5
M1.6. Are you consulting
me regarding the regulatory issues and section 10.2?
[Request-Information: is Peter consulting Mark regarding regulatory issues and section 10.2]
Flink1.6
M1.7. If so, it would help if
you told me what 10.2 says.....
[Inform: if Peter does consult Mark, Mark would like to know what 10.2 says]
Sflink1.7
M1.8. Feel free to give me a call if you'd like to discuss.
[Inform: Peter can call Mark if he would like to discuss this]

message.subject: Late Delivery
message.content:
M2.1. Thanks Mark!
[Conventional: thanks]
M2.2. I misunderstood Robbi's mail - I thought you had been working
on the sections of the MSA discussed initially in my mail.
[Inform: misunderstanding about Robbi's mail]
Blink1.5
Sflink2.2
M2.3. However, it would be very helpful if you could identify those portions of the
US MSA that are there solely for US regulatory purposes - they may not be
necessary in the European version and would inevitably cause discussions with
European CP's, where the argument that they refer to US regulatory
requirements may not be easily accepted.
[Inform: Peter would like Mark to identify parts of the US MSA that are there solely for US, rather than European, regulatory purposes]
Sflink2.3
M2.4. Section 10.2(ii) is the one below,
which I would be happy if we could delete for Europe:
[Inform: section 10.2(ii) is posted below, which Peter would like to delete for Europe]
M2.5. (i) it is (a) in connection with each Product, a commercial participant who,
in connection with its activities, incurs risk, in addition to price risk,
related to such Product, has a demonstrable capacity or ability, directly or
through separate bona fide contractual arrangements, to provide or accept
such Product under the terms of a Transaction and (b) is either (1) a
corporation, partnership, organization, trust or other business entity with a
net worth exceeding US$1,000,000 (or the equivalent thereof in any foreign
currency) or has total assets exceeding US$5,000,000 (or the equivalent
thereof in any foreign currency) or (2) an entity, the obligations of which
under this Agreement are guaranteed or otherwise supported by a letter of
credit or keepwell support, or other agreement by any such entity or by an
entity referred to in subsection (b)(1) above;
[Inform: section 10.2(ii) of the US MSA]
Blink1.7

message.subject: Late Delivery
message.content:
[DUPLICATE]
Thanks Mark! I misunderstood Robbi's mail - I thought you had been working
on the sections of the MSA discussed initially in my mail.
However, it would be very helpful if you could identify those portions of the
US MSA that are there solely for US regulatory purposes - they may not be
necessary in the European version and would inevitably cause discussions with
European CP's, where the argument that they refer to US regulatory
requirements may not be easily accepted. Section 10.2(ii) is the one below,
which I would be happy if we could delete for Europe:
(i) it is (a) in connection with each Product, a commercial participant who,
in connection with its activities, incurs risk, in addition to price risk,
related to such Product, has a demonstrable capacity or ability, directly or
through separate bona fide contractual arrangements, to provide or accept
such Product under the terms of a Transaction and (b) is either (1) a
corporation, partnership, organization, trust or other business entity with a
net worth exceeding US$1,000,000 (or the equivalent thereof in any foreign
currency) or has total assets exceeding US$5,000,000 (or the equivalent
thereof in any foreign currency) or (2) an entity, the obligations of which
under this Agreement are guaranteed or otherwise supported by a letter of
credit or keepwell support, or other agreement by any such entity or by an
entity referred to in subsection (b)(1) above;

message.subject: Late Delivery
message.content:
M4.1. Peter and Mark,
[Conventional: salutation]
M4.2. I apologize for the confusion.
[Inform: apology for confusion]
Blink2.2
M4.3. Peter,
[Conventional: salutation]
M4.4. if you have questions concerning
Enron on Line, Mark would be a good person to contact.
[Inform: Peter should contact Mark if he has questions about EOL]
M4.5. I can help you with
the questions on the Master.
[Inform: Robbi can help Peter with questions about the Master]
Blink2.2
M4.6. Note that the European version that was sent to
you does not include US law provisions.
[Inform: Peter should realize that European version sent to him doesn't include US law provisions]
Blink2.3
